Package com.atakmap.map.layer

Interface Layer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Layer2, MapItemsDatabaseLayer, RasterLayer2
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataStoreRasterLayer2, AbstractLayer, AbstractRasterLayer2, AttachmentBillboardLayer, CardLayer, ContourLinesOverlay, CrosshairLayer, CrosshairLayer, CustomGrid, DatasetRasterLayer2, ElevationHeatmapLayer, FeatureLayer3, GLDt2OutlineOverlay.Instance, GridLinesOverlay, HeatMapOverlay, LayerBinLayer, MagnifierLayer, MapOverlayRenderer, MapTargetBubble, MobileImageryRasterLayer2, MultiLayer, NativeImageryRasterLayer2, OffscreenIndicatorController, ProxyLayer, RootMapGroupLayer, RubberModelLayer, SceneLayer, StackLayer, TerrainSlopeLayer, VehicleModelLayer, VideoOverlayLayer, ViewShedLayer2, WidgetsLayer, WidgetsLayer
    public interface Layer
    Map layer interface. A layer is a graphical overlay on the map that may provide additional interactive capabilities. The layer's content may be spatial in nature (e.g. raster or feature data) or may be fixed relative to the map's pixel coordinate system (e.g. a heads-up display).

    The base interface supports name and visibility properties. Subinterfaces should define additional properties and callbacks as necessary.

    Pluggable Layers Framework

    The layer interface represents the model for the layer. It describes the data or content and may provide guidance on how that content is to be rendered. However, rendering of the layer is delegated to a GLLayer implementation.

    GLLayer instances are automatically created when the layer is added to the map. The GLLayer is instantiated using a GLLayerSpi that has been previously registered with the GLLayerFactory. Users may choose to explicitly register their GLLayerSpi before or after map creation; applications subclassing AtakMapView may also register during map initialization via AtakMapView.initGLSurface(). Alternatively, users may choose to register their GLLayerSpi using a static initializer in the Layer class itself. The various implementations that are part of the SDK can be registered via the static method, Layers.registerAll().

    See Also:
    GLLayer, com.atakmap.map.layer.opengl.GLLayerSpi, GLLayerFactory, Layers.registerAll()

    • Method Detail

      • setVisible

        void setVisible​(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the layer. Any registered Layer.OnLayerVisibleChangedListener instances should be notified if the visibility of the layer changes as a result of the invocation of this method.
        Parameters:
        visible - true to make the layer visible, false to make it invisible.

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the layer is currently visible.
        Returns:
        true if the layer is visible, false otherwise.

      • addOnLayerVisibleChangedListener
